intro: Macrolobium heudelotianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom year-round under optimal conditions.
